intro: Solanum garcia-barrigae var. donachui, commonly known as the Donachui nightshade, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, tomatoes, and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in the evening, and its leaves are usually ovate with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
